intro: Pleurolobus hirtus, commonly known as the hairy pleurolobus, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes milkweeds and related species. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, and it produces clusters of small, yellowish flowers. It is often found in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in arid or semi-arid environments. The species is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological adaptations.
